required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cyanoacrylate Use in Free Gingival Graft
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Cyanoacrylate on Self-reported Outcomes and Healing Following Free Gingival Graft Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Present study aims to reveal the effects of cyanoacrylate application at the recipient bed and the donor site in free gingival graft surgery on the healing parameters and patient-based outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Donor site re-epithelization: hydrogen-peroxide is applied to the donor area with the help of an injector, and it is recorded as complete when no foaming occurs
Donor site re-epithelization: hydrogen-peroxide is applied to the donor area with the help of an injector, and it is recorded as complete when no foaming occurs
Donor site re-epithelization: hydrogen-peroxide is applied to the donor area with the help of an injector, and it is recorded as complete when no foaming occurs
Visual analogue scale (VAS) (0-10), self-reported outcome 0 - no pain (min.) 10 - unbearable (max.)
Visual analogue scale (VAS) (0-10), self-reported outcome 0 - no pain (min.) 10 - unbearable (max.)

The patients are asked to fill provided OHIP-14 forms Questionnaire about satisfaction related to oral health, scored as 0-4 (never - always) 14 questions in total 0 (min.) - 56 (max.) Lower scores represent higher oral health related life quality

Mesio-distal (horizontal) and apico-coronal (vertical) width of the graft is measured with a periodontal probe, rounding to the nearest mm
Mesio-distal (horizontal) and apico-coronal (vertical) width of the graft is measured with a periodontal probe, rounding to the nearest mm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the beginning of the surgery (baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: 15 endodontic reamer is inserted to the palatal mucosa 5 mm apical of the gingival margin of the second premolar; under local anesthesia

secondary_outcome.measure: Paresthesia / hyperesthesia in the donor site
secondary_outcome.description: The patient marks the visual analogue scale (0-10) after rubbing the donor site with a periodontal probe (to give a reference, symmetrical area is rubbed first) 0 - Paresthesia / hyperesthesia, 10 - no sensation difference with the reference area

Color harmony between the graft and the neighboring keratinized tissue at the recipient site, examiner gives a score ranging 0-10 0 - completely different tone/color of the graft; 10 - no detectible tone difference

Color harmony between the graft and the neighboring keratinized tissue at the recipient site, examiner gives a score ranging 0-10 0 - completely different tone/color of the graft; 10 - no detectible tone difference

Color harmony between the graft and the neighboring keratinized tissue at the recipient site, examiner gives a score ranging 0-10 0 - completely different tone/color of the graft; 10 - no detectible tone difference

Color harmony between the graft and the neighboring keratinized tissue at the recipient site, examiner gives a score ranging 0-10 0 - completely different tone/color of the graft; 10 - no detectible tone difference

Color harmony between the graft and the neighboring keratinized tissue at the recipient site, examiner gives a score ranging 0-10 0 - completely different tone/color of the graft; 10 - no detectible tone difference

arm_group.description: The graft is stabilized and the donor site is coated with cyanoacrylate.
6/0 polyvinylidene fluoride sutures are used for stabilization, while the donor site is left untreated.

intervention.description: 1.5-2 x 5 x 10 mm size epithelialized graft harvested from the palate is stabilized in the mandibular anterior single-tooth recession region
N-Butyl-Cyanoacryle is applied to stabilize the graft to the recipient bed and to coat the donor site wound
The graft is stabilized with 6/0 polyvinylidene fluoride suture to the recipient bed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Single-tooth gingival recession in the anterior mandibular region
- Pain with chewing or oral hygiene practice
- Ongoing recession
Exclusion Criteria:
- Systemic disease
- Smoking
- Pregnancy / lactation
